title: Staten Island Ferry
place: Whitehall Terminal, Manhattan to St. George
desc: Completely free ferry with stunning views of the Statue of Liberty and NYC skyline. Runs 24/7, no tickets needed.

title: The High Line
desc: Free public park built on a historic freight rail line elevated above the streets. Art installations and gardens.

title: Central Park
desc: Free access to one of the world's most famous parks. Walking paths, lakes, and free events year-round.

title: Brooklyn Bridge
desc: Walk or bike across this historic bridge for free. Pedestrian walkway always open. Best before 9am to avoid crowds.

title: New York Public Library
place: Stephen A. Schwarzman Building, 5th Ave at 42nd St
desc: Visit the iconic Rose Main Reading Room and see free exhibitions including the Polonsky Exhibition of Library Treasures.

title: Federal Hall
desc: Free museum at the site where George Washington took the oath of office. Run by National Park Service.

title: Governors Island
desc: Free ferry on weekends, free island access with historic forts, art installations, and hammocks.

title: Griffith Observatory
desc: Free admission to one of LA's most iconic spots. See the city from above, explore space exhibits, and use public telescopes at night.

title: Getty Center
desc: Free admission to world-class art museum with stunning architecture and gardens. Parking fee applies ($20).

title: Hollywood Walk of Fame
place: Hollywood Blvd between Gower and La Brea
desc: See over 2,700 stars honoring celebrities. Free self-guided walking tour of Hollywood history.

title: Venice Beach Boardwalk
desc: Iconic boardwalk with street performers, skate park, muscle beach, and people watching. Completely free.

title: Runyon Canyon Park
desc: Famous hiking spot with stunning city views. Free parking and trails for all levels. Popular with celebrities.

title: Exposition Park Rose Garden
desc: 7-acre public rose garden with over 200 varieties. Free and beautiful year-round.

title: Millennium Park
desc: Home of 'The Bean' (Cloud Gate) sculpture, Crown Fountain, and free summer concerts at Jay Pritzker Pavilion.

title: Lincoln Park Zoo
desc: One of the oldest free zoos in the US. See lions, polar bears, gorillas and more. Completely free, year-round.

title: Chicago Cultural Center
desc: Stunning building with world's largest stained glass Tiffany dome. Free art exhibitions and concerts.

title: Navy Pier
desc: Free fireworks on Wednesdays and Saturdays in summer. Lakefront views, gardens, and people watching.

title: Lakefront Trail
desc: Free walking and biking path with stunning lake views. Connects beaches, parks, and neighborhoods.

title: Garfield Park Conservatory
desc: One of the largest conservatories in the US. Free admission to desert house, fern room, and seasonal flower shows.

title: National Museum of Mexican Art
desc: Largest Latino cultural organization in the US. Always free admission to permanent and rotating exhibits.

title: Hermann Park
desc: 445-acre urban oasis with Japanese Garden, walking trails, and free outdoor performances at Miller Outdoor Theatre.

title: The Menil Collection
desc: World-class art museum with works from Paleolithic to contemporary. Always free. Parking also free.

title: Discovery Green
desc: 12-acre downtown park with interactive fountains, art installations, and free events like yoga and outdoor movies.

title: Buffalo Bayou Park
desc: 160-acre park with hiking trails, skyline views, and nightly bat colony emergence under Waugh Drive Bridge.

title: Gerald D. Hines Waterwall
desc: 64-foot semi-circular fountain recirculating 11,000 gallons per minute. Iconic Houston landmark.

title: Camelback Mountain
desc: Famous hiking trails (Echo Canyon and Cholla) with stunning city views. Free but challenging.

title: South Mountain Park
desc: One of the largest municipal parks in the US with 50+ miles of trails. Free entry.

title: Arizona Capitol Museum
desc: Free museum in the historic capitol building. Learn about Arizona's history from territorial days to present.

title: Phoenix Art Museum
desc: Free admission to permanent collection on Wednesday evenings. One of the largest art museums in the Southwest.

title: Desert Botanical Garden
desc: Free admission for Arizona residents on the second Tuesday of each month. Limited tickets available.

title: Papago Park
desc: Hole-in-the-Rock hiking trail, lagoons, and picnic areas. Free access.

title: Philadelphia Museum of Art
date: First Sunday of month, Wednesdays after 5pm
desc: Pay-what-you-wish admission on First Sundays and Wednesday evenings. Famous for the 'Rocky Steps'.

title: Barnes Foundation
desc: Free admission to one of the world's finest art collections on First Sundays. Free tickets required.

title: Independence Hall
desc: Birthplace of the Declaration of Independence and Constitution. Free timed entry tickets required.

title: Liberty Bell
desc: Iconic symbol of American independence. Free, no tickets required.

title: Philadelphia Museum of Art
date: First Sunday of month, Wednesdays after 5pm
desc: Pay-what-you-wish admission on First Sundays and Wednesday evenings. Famous for the 'Rocky Steps'.

title: Reading Terminal Market
desc: Historic public market with dozens of food vendors. Free to enter, pay for food.

title: The Alamo
desc: Free admission to historic mission. Timed entry required.

title: San Antonio River Walk
desc: Free public walking paths along the river with shops, restaurants, and beautiful scenery.

title: San Antonio Museum of Art
desc: Free admission on Tuesday evenings.

title: Japanese Tea Garden
place: 3853 N St Mary's St, San Antonio
desc: Free historic Japanese garden with ponds, bridges, and waterfalls.

title: Mission San José
desc: Part of San Antonio Missions National Historical Park. Free admission, run by National Park Service.

title: Balboa Park
desc: 1,200-acre urban park with gardens, walking paths, and museums. Free access to grounds.

title: La Jolla Tide Pools
desc: Free tide pooling — observe marine life in natural pools during low tide.

title: Mission Beach Boardwalk
desc: Free access to beach and boardwalk. Belmont Park amusement area is also free to enter.

title: Torrey Pines State Natural Reserve
place: 12600 N Torrey Pines Rd, San Diego
desc: Free hiking trails with ocean views. Parking fee applies.

title: Cabrillo National Monument
desc: Stunning views of the bay and ocean. Free with National Park pass.

title: Dallas Museum of Art
desc: Permanent collection always free. Special exhibitions may have fee.

title: Klyde Warren Park
desc: Free park built over a highway with food trucks, activities, and green space.

title: Nasher Sculpture Center
desc: Free admission on first Saturdays. World-class sculpture collection.

title: Dallas Arboretum
desc: Free admission during certain winter weekdays. Check website for dates.

title: White Rock Lake
desc: Free access to lake trails and picnic areas. Popular for biking and walking.

title: San Jose Museum of Art
desc: Free admission on first weekend of month.

title: Alum Rock Park
desc: California's oldest municipal park. Free access to trails and mineral springs.

title: Rosicrucian Egyptian Museum
desc: Free admission on second Saturdays. Largest collection of Egyptian artifacts in western US.

title: Municipal Rose Garden
desc: 5-acre rose garden with over 3,500 rose bushes. Free admission.

title: Plaza de Cesar Chavez
place: 1 Paseo de San Antonio, San Jose
desc: Downtown park with fountains and events. Free to visit.

title: Zilker Park
desc: Free entry to Austin's most popular park. Home to Barton Springs Pool, hiking, and picnic areas.

title: Barton Springs Pool
desc: Free early morning swimming in natural spring-fed pool from 5-8 AM daily.

title: Texas State Capitol
desc: Free guided tours of the historic capitol building. Larger than US Capitol.

title: Blanton Museum of Art
place: 200 E Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Austin
desc: Free admission every Thursday. One of the best university art museums.

title: Lady Bird Lake Hike and Bike Trail
desc: 10-mile loop trail around lake with stunning city views. Free access.

title: Cummer Museum
desc: Free admission on first Saturdays with beautiful gardens and art collection.

title: Jacksonville Beach
desc: Free access to one of Florida's best beaches. Parking fees may apply.

title: Riverside Arts Market
desc: Free outdoor market with local artists, food vendors, and live music.

title: Museum of Contemporary Art
desc: Free admission on first Wednesdays. Contemporary art exhibitions.

title: Friendship Fountain
desc: Iconic fountain in St. Johns River Park. Free to view and picnic nearby.
